Of course, here are some other technological tools or software that have been proven effective for neurodiverse individuals:

1. Happily - an emotional regulation program designed for children with autism. The program utilizes visual learning and interactive games to teach children resilience and coping mechanisms.

2. Proloquo2Go - an augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) app that helps individuals with speech and language difficulties, including autism, cerebral palsy, or Down syndrome, to communicate with others using symbols, pictures, and text-to-speech.

3. MyNoise - sound therapy app that provides tailored soundscapes to help relieve stress, anxiety, and improve focus. It is especially useful for individuals with sensory issues or those who struggle with auditory processing.

4. Ginger Keyboard - an adaptive keyboard app that helps individuals with dyslexia, ADHD, or other related conditions to type accurately and efficiently. It includes advanced spelling and grammar correction tools, and text prediction functions.

5. Brain.fm - music streaming service with neurologically optimized tracks that help improve concentration, productivity, and relaxation. It is useful for individuals with ADHD, anxiety, or other mental health conditions.

These are just a few examples of the many technological tools and software available that can make a significant impact on the daily lives of neurodiverse individuals.
